page.title: 02SWINSTEAD VILLAGE AND AREA
page.content: are a number of brick buildings (esp. on the council estate and Old People's sheltered accomodation). The population of the village is now stable and there are plenty of children (although no school as the primary school closed three years ago). There are many people who live in the village who work for the Trust (see above) but there are an increasing number who work in Stamford, Grantham, Bourne and Peterborough. There is an increasing number of 'new people' in the village. The main road through the village is a B road but there is not a lot of traffic. What traffic there is tends to be asociated with the village and the farms in the area.
